catalyst: The catalyst used in the experiment is the TNT catalyst decorated with Au NPs (gold nanoparticles).
co_catalyst: The co-catalyst used in the experiment is Au (gold) nanoparticles (Au NPs).
light source: The light source used in the experiment is a solar simulator composed of a 300 W Xe arc lamp (type 69911, Newport-Oriel Instruments, Stratford, CT, USA), a lamp housing (type 67005, Newport), and a solar filter (type 81094, Newport).
lamp: The lamp used in the experiment is a 300 W Xe arc lamp (type 69911, Newport-Oriel Instruments, Stratford, CT, USA).
reaction medium: The reaction medium used in the experiment is a solution of NaH13CO3 placed in the reactor with H2SO4 to form 13CO2 in situ, and then 2 v/v of BMIM-BF4 was added to the bicarbonate solution.
reactor type: The reactor type for the experiment is a one-compartment stainless steel reactor with an internal capacity of 250 mL.
